intro: Glochidion lenormandii, commonly known as the Lenormand's glabrous leaf vine, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its small, simple leaves and produces inconspicuous yellow flowers. It thrives in tropical rainforest environments and is often found growing as a climbing vine. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and less-studied species.
